alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 09 at 2:46PM MDT until May 09 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Central San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 243 PM MDT, a large area of blowing dust stretched from near Tohatchi northeast across US550 and Blanco Trading Post toward Navajo Dam and Dulce. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind gusts in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 103 and 157. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 57 and 128. Locations impacted include... Bloomfield, Aztec, Navajo Dam, Nageezi, El Vado, Lake Valley, Brimhall Nizhoni, Archuleta, Heron Lake State Park and Navajo Lake State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Albuquerque.
